required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pertussis Infection in Adolescents and Adults With Prolonged Cough
clinical_study.official_title: Bordetella Pertussis Infection Among Adolescents and Adults With Prolonged Cough

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to determine the burden of pertussis infection among adolescents and adults with prolonged cough in four Asian countries, namely Malaysia, Philippines, Taiwan and Thailand. This study also aims to assess the health economic (HE) impact of pertussis.

detailed_description.textblock:
Data from this cross-sectional study will be useful in reviewing the need for introduction of booster doses of pertussis vaccines in adolescent and adult population in Malaysia, Philippines, Taiwan and Thailand.
This study will enrol patients with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more and detect pertussis with serological tests in order to estimate the prevalence of pertussis infection among such patients. No vaccine will be administered during this study.

primary_outcome.description: Serological evidence of pertussis infection was defined as anti-pertussis toxin (PT) immunoglobulin G (IgG) level indicative of active or recent infection. The parameters presented were defined as follows: Seropositive = Subjects with anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥10 IU/ml , Seronegative = Subjects with anti-PT IgG ELISA levels < 10 IU/ml , Sero-confirmed infection = Subjects with anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml , Active infection 1= Anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥ 100 IU/ml indicative of active or recent infection, Active infection 2 = Anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥ 125 IU/ml indicative of active or recent infection

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Specific Clinical Features
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of clinical data collection prior to enrolment (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical features assessed included paroxysm, whoop, night cough, cyanosis, fever post-tussive vomiting, apnoea, cyanosis, coughing up phlegm, sneezes, wheezes, episodes of being unable to stop coughing and breathlessness/chest pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Number of Days Absent From Work Due to Cough
secondary_outcome.description: Absenteeism was assessed as the mean number of days missed from work due to cough.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Number of Sero-confirmed Subjects With Loss of Income Due to Missing Work
secondary_outcome.description: Loss of income due to missing work for sero-confirmed subjects was measured in the local currency of each country, as follows: Malaysia - Malaysian ringgit (RM), Taiwan - New Taiwan dollar (NTD), Thailand - Thai baht (BAHT).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Number of Visits to Specific Healthcare Resources
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare resource utilization was assessed by the mean number of visits to any type of physicians.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Travel Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects - Malaysia
secondary_outcome.description: The travel costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Malaysia - Malaysian ringgit (RM).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Travel Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects - Taiwan
secondary_outcome.description: The travel costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Taiwan - New Taiwan dollar (NTD)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Travel Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects - Thailand
secondary_outcome.description: The travel costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Thailand - Thai baht (BAHT).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting the GP(s) - Malaysia
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Malaysia - Malaysian ringgit (RM). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the GP(s).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting the GP(s) - Taiwan
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Taiwan - New Taiwan dollar (NTD). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the GP(s).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting the GP(s) - Thailand
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Thailand - Thai baht (BAHT). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the GP(s).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Specialist Clinics - Malaysia
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Malaysia - Malaysian ringgit (RM). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the specialist clinics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Specialist Clinics - Taiwan
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Taiwan - New Taiwan dollar (NTD). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the specialist clinics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Specialist Clinics - Thailand
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Thailand - Thai baht (BAHT). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the specialist clinics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Emergency Rooms - Malaysia
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Malaysia - Malaysian ringgit (RM). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the emergency rooms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Emergency Rooms - Taiwan
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Taiwan - New Taiwan dollar (NTD). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the emergency rooms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Emergency Rooms - Thailand
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Thailand - Thai baht (BAHT). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the emergency rooms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Healthcare Resources in General - Malaysia
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Malaysia - Malaysian ringgit (RM). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the healthcare resources in general

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Healthcare Resources in General - Taiwan
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Taiwan - New Taiwan dollar (NTD). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the healthcare resources in general

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Medical Costs for Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Healthcare Resources in General - Thailand
secondary_outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Thailand - Thai baht (BAHT). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the healthcare resources in general

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Health Economical Impact - Summary of Total Amount of Time Spent by Sero-confirmed Subjects Visiting Healthcare Resources in General
secondary_outcome.description: Total amount of time spent on seeing the doctor(s) which includes the return trip and the overall time spent at clinic(s)/hospital(s) for waiting, consultation, tests, pharmacy etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Impact of Pertussis on Quality of Life of Patients: Number of Participants Reporting Problems With Specific Characteristics
secondary_outcome.description: Health-related quality of life of pertussis patients was assessed using the EQ-5D Questionnaire. The EQ-5D is composed of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), with 3 levels of severity within each dimension. The EQ-5D levels were further dichotomised into "no problems" (level 1) and "with problems" (level 2 & 3). The number of participants within these 2 levels are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Impact of Pertussis on Quality of Life of Patients: Average EQ-5D Index Score
secondary_outcome.description: Health-related quality of life of pertussis patients was assessed using the EQ-5D Questionnaire. The EQ-5D is composed of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), with 3 levels of severity within each dimension. Average of EQ-5D index score (ranging from 0 to 1; 0 being death and 1 being in perfect health) across sero-confirmed participants was reported.

arm_group.description: Malaysian adults aged >19 years with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more.
Taiwanese adults aged >19 years with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more.
Thailandese adults aged >19 years with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more.

intervention.description: 1 blood sample will be collected from each subject.
Quality of Life and HE questionnaires.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adolescents aged 13-18 years or adults aged >18years.
- Presenting with prolonged cough of 2 weeks (14 days) or more.
- Subjects who the investigator believes that they/ their parent(s)/Legally Acceptable Representative(s) [LAR(s)] can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject/ from the parent(s)/LAR of the subject. If the subject below the age of consent is legally eligible, his/her signature on the informed assent form should be obtained.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Child in care.
- Subjects with known chronic cough-causing disease and immunodeficiency.
- Subjects treated with angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors (ACEI), within the past 4 weeks (28 days).

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The duration of enrolment of all subjects was less than a year. Each subject attended one study visit at the time of enrolment, during which Quality of Life (QoL) and Health Economics (HE) questionnaires were administered and one blood sample was drawn.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 337 subjects were enrolled into this study, but only 312 had valid laboratory results. 2 subjects were excluded due to vulnerable conditions, 16 subjects were excluded due to protocol violation and 7 subjects were excluded due to vaccination with pertussis vaccines within 1 year before blood sample collection.

outcome.title: Serological Evidence of Pertussis Infection
outcome.description: Serological evidence of pertussis infection was defined as anti-pertussis toxin (PT) immunoglobulin G (IgG) level indicative of active or recent infection. The parameters presented were defined as follows: Seropositive = Subjects with anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥10 IU/ml , Seronegative = Subjects with anti-PT IgG ELISA levels < 10 IU/ml , Sero-confirmed infection = Subjects with anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml , Active infection 1= Anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥ 100 IU/ml indicative of active or recent infection, Active infection 2 = Anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥ 125 IU/ml indicative of active or recent infection
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort which included all subjects with valid laboratory results.

measure.title: Serological Evidence of Pertussis Infection
measure.description: Serological evidence of pertussis infection was defined as anti-pertussis toxin (PT) immunoglobulin G (IgG) level indicative of active or recent infection. The parameters presented were defined as follows: Seropositive = Subjects with anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥10 IU/ml , Seronegative = Subjects with anti-PT IgG ELISA levels < 10 IU/ml , Sero-confirmed infection = Subjects with anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml , Active infection 1= Anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥ 100 IU/ml indicative of active or recent infection, Active infection 2 = Anti-PT IgG ELISA levels ≥ 125 IU/ml indicative of active or recent infection
measure.population: The analysis was done on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort which included all subjects with valid laboratory results.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Specific Clinical Features
outcome.description: Clinical features assessed included paroxysm, whoop, night cough, cyanosis, fever post-tussive vomiting, apnoea, cyanosis, coughing up phlegm, sneezes, wheezes, episodes of being unable to stop coughing and breathlessness/chest pain.
outcome.time_frame: At time of clinical data collection prior to enrolment (Day 0)
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity which included all subjects with valid laboratory results. For this outcome the subjects were grouped by their infection status: Subjects with Sero-confirmed infection and Subjects with Non-sero-confirmed infection.

group.title: Subjects With Sero-confirmed Infection
group.description: Adults aged >19 years with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more, with with anti-pertussis Immunoglobulin G ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml.

group.title: Subjects With Non-sero-confirmed Infection
group.description: Adults aged >19 years with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more, with anti-pertussis Immunoglobulin G ELISA levels < 62.5 IU/m

measure.title: Number of Participants With Specific Clinical Features
measure.description: Clinical features assessed included paroxysm, whoop, night cough, cyanosis, fever post-tussive vomiting, apnoea, cyanosis, coughing up phlegm, sneezes, wheezes, episodes of being unable to stop coughing and breathlessness/chest pain.
measure.population: The analysis was done on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity which included all subjects with valid laboratory results. For this outcome the subjects were grouped by their infection status: Subjects with Sero-confirmed infection and Subjects with Non-sero-confirmed infection.

outcome.population: The assessment was performed only on the subjects with sero-confirmed infection, i.e with Immunoglobulin G ELISA levels ≥ 62.5 IU/ml, and with available data.

outcome.description: The medical costs were assessed in the local currency of each country, as follows: Malaysia - Malaysian ringgit (RM). Total medical cost included the cost spent for consultation, medicines, laboratory tests etc., for visiting the specialist clinics.
outcome.population: The assessment was performed only on the Malaysian subjects with sero-confirmed infection, i.e with Immunoglobulin G ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml, and with available data.

measurement_list.measurement: Only one participant reported any consultation with the Specialist. Standard Deviation cannot be computed on a single value.

class.title: Time spent for treatment in the emergency room(s)

measurement_list.measurement: Only one participant reported time spent at the Emergency Room. Standard Deviation cannot be computed on a single value.
No Emergency Room visitis were reported, hence Standard Deviation could not be computed.

class.title: Total time spent to visit the healthcare resources

measurement_list.measurement: Only one participant reported time spent at any healthcare resources. Standard Deviation cannot be computed on a single value.

outcome.title: Assessment of the Impact of Pertussis on Quality of Life of Patients: Number of Participants Reporting Problems With Specific Characteristics
outcome.description: Health-related quality of life of pertussis patients was assessed using the EQ-5D Questionnaire. The EQ-5D is composed of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), with 3 levels of severity within each dimension. The EQ-5D levels were further dichotomised into "no problems" (level 1) and "with problems" (level 2 & 3). The number of participants within these 2 levels are reported.
outcome.population: The assessment was performed only on the subjects with sero-confirmed infection, i.e with Immunoglobulin G ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml, and with available data.

group.title: Malaysian Sero-confirmed Subjects Group
group.description: Malaysian adults aged >19 years with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more, with anti-pertussis Immunoglobulin G ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml

measure.title: Assessment of the Impact of Pertussis on Quality of Life of Patients: Number of Participants Reporting Problems With Specific Characteristics
measure.description: Health-related quality of life of pertussis patients was assessed using the EQ-5D Questionnaire. The EQ-5D is composed of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), with 3 levels of severity within each dimension. The EQ-5D levels were further dichotomised into "no problems" (level 1) and "with problems" (level 2 & 3). The number of participants within these 2 levels are reported.
measure.population: The assessment was performed only on the subjects with sero-confirmed infection, i.e with Immunoglobulin G ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml, and with available data.

outcome.title: Assessment of the Impact of Pertussis on Quality of Life of Patients: Average EQ-5D Index Score
outcome.description: Health-related quality of life of pertussis patients was assessed using the EQ-5D Questionnaire. The EQ-5D is composed of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), with 3 levels of severity within each dimension. Average of EQ-5D index score (ranging from 0 to 1; 0 being death and 1 being in perfect health) across sero-confirmed participants was reported.
outcome.population: The assessment was performed only on the subjects with sero-confirmed infection, i.e with Immunoglobulin G ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml, and with available data.

measure.description: Health-related quality of life of pertussis patients was assessed using the EQ-5D Questionnaire. The EQ-5D is composed of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), with 3 levels of severity within each dimension. Average of EQ-5D index score (ranging from 0 to 1; 0 being death and 1 being in perfect health) across sero-confirmed participants was reported.
measure.population: The assessment was performed only on the subjects with sero-confirmed infection, i.e with Immunoglobulin G ELISA levels ≥62.5 IU/ml, and with available data.

reported_events.time_frame: Serious Adverse Events were collected during the entire study period (at Day 0 from enrolment till completion of all study procedures).
reported_events.desc: Only Serious Adverse Events were monitored in this trial, Other (non-serious) Adverse Events were not collected as planned per protocol.

group.title: Malaysia Group
group.description: Malaysian adults aged >19 years with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more.

group.title: Taiwan Group
group.description: Taiwanese adults aged >19 years with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more.

group.description: Thailandese adults aged >19 years with prolonged cough of 2 weeks or more.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
